sentences.en: Businesses are feeling the indirect effects from the recession that'sgoing on elsewhere.
sentences.cn: 企业感受到了别处经济衰退带来的间接影响。

sentences.en: Fiat has been one of the greatest casualties of the recession.
sentences.cn: 菲亚特一直是经济萧条中损失最惨重的公司之一。

sentences.en: He has had to eat his words about the company being recession-proof.
sentences.cn: 他不得不收回他说过的公司能免受经济衰退影响的话。

sentences.en: In spite of the recession, profits have galloped ahead.
sentences.cn: 尽管还处于萧条期，利润却迅猛增长。

sentences.en: Most consumers seem unconvinced that the recession is over.
sentences.cn: 大多数消费者似乎都不相信经济衰退已经过去。

sentences.en: Pulling out of a recession is a lengthy and drawn-out process.
sentences.cn: 从经济衰退中走出来需要漫长的过程。

sentences.en: Recession has simply accelerated changes that have been reshaping the industry anyway.
sentences.cn: 经济萧条只不过加速了原本就在改变行业状况的变化。

sentences.en: The country had come through the worst of the recession.
sentences.cn: 该国已经度过了经济衰退最糟糕的时期。

sentences.en: The country is in the depths of a recession.
sentences.cn: 该国正遭遇最严重的经济衰退。

sentences.en: the economic recession of the early 1980s
The fall in inflation is the silver lining of the prolonged recession.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀的下降是长期经济衰退中的一线转机。

sentences.en: The recent deterioration has been caused by an apparently endless recession.
sentences.cn: 看似永无止境的经济衰退导致了最近的恶化。

sentences.en: The recession and hospital bills drove them into bankruptcy.
sentences.cn: 经济衰退和医疗账单逼得他们破产了。

sentences.en: The recession is largely blamed for the disappointing response to the appeal.
sentences.cn: 对此呼吁的反应令人失望，主要归咎于经济衰退。

sentences.en: There is deep recession in the UK.
sentences.cn: 英国处于严重的经济衰退之中。

sentences.en: We have allowed spending and borrowing to rise in this recession.
sentences.cn: 在此经济萧条时期，我们容许增加消费和借贷。

sentences.en: Whenever recession strikes, a chain reaction is set into motion.
sentences.cn: 只要经济不景气，连锁反应就开始了。

words.tran_cn: （礼拜仪式后牧师及唱诗班退场时所唱的）退场赞美诗

trans.tran_cn: 经济衰退，不景气，后退，撤退，凹处，退场
trans.tran_en: a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity etc in a country than usual
